sep.gaia.resources.tiles2d

Class TileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.gaia.resources.ResourceObservable<R>
      • sep.gaia.resources.DataResourceManager<TileResource>
        • sep.gaia.resources.tiles2d.TileManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LoaderEventListener<TileResource>, QuerySplitter<TileQuery>, StateObserver

    public final class TileManager
extends DataResourceManager<TileResource>
implements LoaderEventListener<TileResource>, QuerySplitter<TileQuery>
    StateObservable: TileManager is responsible for the 2d map tiles. It's parent class DataResourceManager is a StateObserver. So TileManager observes the TileState and if it gets notified, it will update it's usedResourcesSet immediately and search in it's cache classes TemporaryCache and PersistantCache for the now current necessary TileResources. If it requests a cache miss, TileManager will query the necessary TileResource objects to the TileLoader object for loading the missing tiles of the API servers. ResourceObservable: As TileManager is a subclass of DataResourceManager, it's also a ResourceObservable and therefore observed by ResourceAdapter implementations. TileManager will immediately notify its observers, after its usedResourceSet is updated.
    Author:
    Johannes Bauer (specification), Matthias Fisch, Johannes Bauer (implementation)
    See Also:
    DataResourceManager, TileState+, TileLoader

    • Method Detail

      • loadStylesFromXML

        public boolean loadStylesFromXML()
        Reads all available styles from the XML-formatted file. The location of this is specified by the variable TILE_STYLE_FILE of Environment. The read XML is checked for fulfilling the format specified in the XML-schema stored at the path with the environment-variable TILE_STYLE_FILE_SCHEMA. The styles generated are stored in styles. The first style in the index will picked as the initial style.
        Returns:
        true if the file could be successfully read and both the XML and its schema was formatted correctly. false will be returned otherwise.

      • getAvailableStyles

        public java.util.List<Style> getAvailableStyles()
        Returns all styles that TileManager holds.
        Returns:
        All available styles that GAIA knows. These Styles are necessary for knowing the URL of the tile server and the label member of each style specifies the directory name for saving the TileResource objects to the PersistentCache. If there are no styles at all, e.g. because parsing the specifying file failed, returns an empty list.

      • splitQuery

        public java.util.Collection<TileQuery> splitQuery(TileQuery query)
        Description copied from interface: QuerySplitter
        Splits the query into smaller parts that can be processed in separate threads. Used by Loader when splitting a bigger query into parts and delegating processing to workers.
        Specified by:
        splitQuery in interface QuerySplitter<TileQuery>
        Returns:
        Collection of query-packages forming the query in union.
